result.execSummary:
The defendant Gene J Broesch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gene J Broesch is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gene J Broesch was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Gene J Broesch was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample. Psychological evaluation and any treatment recommended. No contact with D.K. Not be on Duck Creek Road for any reason, to Thompson St. between Mullett and Pauquette Streets. Not to be at Kwik Trip south for the next 6 months. Ct. 1 Dismissed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gene J Broesch

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation terminated on 9-12-19 with no unpaid financial obligations

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Gene J Broesch, appeared. Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant agrees with revocation of the DPA. Court revoked the DPA on 15CF296, and found him guilty of Cts. 2 & 3.  Rights/Elements. Defendant pled guilty to Ct. 1 of 17CM110. Court found guilty. Judgment was entered. In 17CM110 Cts. 2-5 Dismissed and read in. 17CM353 is dismissed and read in. In 15CF296 and 17CM110 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years. Conditions of probation on each case include: Submit DNA sample. Psychological evaluation and any treatment recommended. No contact with D.K. Not be on Duck Creek Rd. for any reason, or Thompson Street between Mullett and Pauquette Streets. Not to be at Kwik Trip South for the next 6 months.  In 15CF196 Ct. 2 $443.00 costs. Ct. 3 $243.00 costs. In 17CM110 $443.00 costs. Defendant made statement to the Court. 10:55/11:40

Defendant, Gene J Broesch, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed. Defendant is to go to Br. 2 to get order to show cause scheduled. Bond remains.

Money orders for restitution prepared.  Stip for restitution will be done.   Court will accept recommendation.  Court imposes: Count 1 dismissed. Deferred prosecution agreement on count 2 & 3.  0 days jail credit.  2:41 pm.

standard felony conditions, no contact w/D.K. and F.K., directly, telephonically, or electronically, no contact through 3rd party, other than through law enforcement, no contact w/relatives, their residence, or place of employment, not to make false allegations of F.K. drunk driving

Defendant Gene J Broesch in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Roger L. Klopp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, $2,000.00 sign bond, standard felony conditions, no contact w/D.K. and F.K., directly, telephonically, or electronically, or through 3rd party, other than through law enforcement, no contact w/relatives, their residence, or their place of employment, not to make false allegations of F.K. drunk driving, waives time limits to prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:20 pm.  Return date scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
